FRS_Method: GPS CODE (PSEUDO RANGE) STANDARD POSITION (SA OFF)

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
MORRILL ELEVATOR, INC. IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS WHICH SELLS ANHYDROUS AMMONIA TO AREA CROP PRODUCERS. THE FACILITY HAS ONE 18,000 GALLON TANK AND A 12,000 GALLON TANK WITH A TOTAL CAPACITY OF 132,000 POUNDS. THE TANKS ARE DESIGNED AND MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL APPLICABLE LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS. THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR TANKS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND WE COMPLY WITH ALL OF THEIR REQUEST FOR IMPROVEMENTS.

THE WORST CASE SECENARIO WOULD HAVE A TOXIC GAS RELEASE OF 132,000 POUNDS OF AMMONIA WITH A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF 1.1 MILES AFFECTING APPROXIMATELY 10 AREA CITIZENS. THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO WOULD RELEASE 11,908 LBS. OF AMMONIA THROUGH THETRANSFER HOSE AND WOULD HAVE A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF .41 MILES. THIS RELEASE WOULD HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO AFFECT APPROXIMATELY 10 PEOPLE.          

THIS COMPANY POLICY HAS BEEN TO TRAIN EMPLOYEES ON A ANNUAL BASIS OF SAFE HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA . THE EMPLOYEES WHO WORK IN THE ANNONIA PLANT ARE TRAINED IN THE SAFETY INFORMATION, HAZARDS, OPERATING PROCEDURES AND THE MAINTENANCE PRACTICES OF THE TYPICAL FACILITY. THE EMPLOYEES ALWAYS WEAR GOGGLES AND THE APPROPRIATE GLOVES WHILE FILLING NURSE TANKS. ABOVE ALL, THEY MAKE SURE TO HAVE CLEAN SAFETY WATER ON HAND DURING AMMONIA OPERATIONS. OUR SAFETY RECORD ALLOWS US TO PROUDLY REPORT THAT THERE HAVE BEEN NO INJURY ACCIDENTS SINCE WE ENTERED INTO THE ANHYDROUS BUSINESS.

OUR EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN IS SHARED WITH OUR LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT. THEY ARE AWARE OF THE DANGERS OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA. THEY'VE ALSO, AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY.
